title: Improving Patient Pre-screening for Clinical Trials: Assisting Physicians with Large Language Models. (arXiv:2304.07396v1 [cs.LG])
abstract: Physicians considering clinical trials for their patients are met with the laborious process of checking many text based eligibility criteria. Large Language Models (LLMs) have shown to perform well for clinical information extraction and clinical reasoning, including medical tests, but not yet in real-world scenarios. This paper investigates the use of InstructGPT to assist physicians in determining eligibility for clinical trials based on a patient's summarised medical profile. Using a prompting strategy combining one-shot, selection-inference and chain-of-thought techniques, we investigate the performance of LLMs on 10 synthetically created patient profiles. Performance is evaluated at four levels: ability to identify screenable eligibility criteria from a trial given a medical profile; ability to classify for each individual criterion whether the patient qualifies; the overall classification whether a patient is eligible for a clinical trial and the percentage of criteria to be scr

translated_title: 改善临床试验的患者预筛选：利用大型语言模型辅助医生
translated_abstract: 考虑到患者的临床试验，医生需要进行繁琐的检查，以确定患者是否符合文本基准。大型语言模型（LLMs）已被证明在临床信息提取和临床推理方面表现良好，但尚未在现实场景中得到应用。本文研究了使用InstructGPT辅助医生根据患者的医疗简况确定其是否符合临床试验的资格。使用一次性、选择-推理和思维链策略相结合的提示策略，我们研究了LLMs在10个合成患者简况上的表现。在四个级别上评估了性能：能否从临床试验中给出的医疗简况中识别筛选资格标准；能否为每个单独的标准分类是否符合患者；整体分类是否符合临床试验资格以及需要筛选资格标准的百分比。
tldr: 本文研究了使用大型语言模型InstructGPT辅助医生预筛选患者是否符合临床试验资格。通过10个合成患者简况的性能评估，展示了LLMs在识别筛选资格标准、单独分类、整体分类、以及需要筛选资格标准的百分比上的表现。
en_tdlr: This paper investigates the use of InstructGPT to assist physicians in determining eligibility for clinical trials based on a patient's summarised medical profile. Through evaluation on 10 synthetically created patient profiles, the performance of LLMs in identifying eligibility criteria, individual classification, overall classification, and the percentage of criteria to be screened is demonstrated.
